attributes.comment:
My husband Paul and I are a couple that is right now going through the process to
adopt a baby from China. We recently received our I-797c after paying $545 for
the I -600a application and $140 for our fingerprints to be done.
This of course is in addition to the roughly $10,000 that we have already spent in
other government office fees (certifiation, authentication, notary) and agency fees.
With the current wait times from submission of dossier to travelling to China at
close to 2 years, it is almost definite that we will need to send in another I-600a
application and have our fingerprints done again as they expire in 18months and
15 months. At the current fee structure, my family will have paid $1370 (not
including the update of our homestudy that will need to be submitted with the I-
600a application) for 2 sets of the same documents.
While any amount of money is nothing in our eyes, when we are talking about our
future daughter, PLEASE don't make what is already a hardship, both emotional
and financial, any harder on familes who are adopting internationally.
Thank you for your time and consideration.
Sincerely,
Heather & Paul
Future adoptive parents
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Heather N. Kelsch
